title: the story of my ranked life
body:
when i first started playing ranked earlier this year, i was a really salty ass hole and i always blamed my team mates for my mistakes. i lost almost every game.
so then i stopped playing ranked for a while and i stopped being cancerous and i stared blaming myself for my mistakes and i improved overall and became more of a team player.
So i played 3 games of ranked yesterday with my improved self and i won all 3 with positive k/d (before i was getting horrible kd because i spent half the time getting angry at other people)
i'm only bronze II and i know i'm not good, i usually only get 100 cs at 20 minutes but this season i feel like i can get into silver, where before i already got demoted once and was about to be demoted again
so the number 1 tip I've learned throught my experiences is ; don't be salty and don't blame others, or lag for you mistakes

replies.body: I hope you do, I used to be silver 4, then I lost 30 ranked games in a row. Now Ive spent my time going from B5 to B1 79 LP in 5 days, the trick is don't rage, ever since I've stopped raging about a year ago the games are a lot more fun, you just have to accept responsibility for your deaths and mistakes, and if your team mates rage, ignore them.
